[16-Jun-24 04:06 PM] akyantor#0000
A quick somewhat stupid question. If you place a production order for more than one run of goods. Does it produce all the goods at the end of the order, or make them incrementally available throughout the run? For example, if I specify a farm order with an order size of 5 GRN, do I get 4 GRN emitted periodically, or 20 GRN at the end of the entire order.

{Attachments}
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/870777970367811604/1252006348217122866/image.png?ex=68148b06&is=68133986&hm=b080549b51f589fac1082b015a62370ec8e2b723175203a7b21de92033aa840e&


[16-Jun-24 04:07 PM] churavis#0000
It takes the inputs from your inventory at the beginning and then puts the outputs into your inventory all at once at the end


[16-Jun-24 04:07 PM] akyantor#0000
Ok, good to know.

{Reactions}
üëç 

[17-Jun-24 09:43 AM] hernanduer#0000
if you cancel it mid order though, you get the % of time completed in products, and get back the inverse % of inputs


[17-Jun-24 09:43 AM] hernanduer#0000
floored though, so it's a loss


[17-Jun-24 10:03 AM] akyantor#0000
Yeah, I think I saw that before with order size 1.

[25-Jun-24 09:24 AM] archielvahr#0000
Free business idea... someone should start a:

Municipal Management Business:
The MMB supplies the COGC, SST, and INF on  your planet in exchange for direct payments from the government. It would set a very healthy rate for those basic materials, DW, MCG, PE, RAT, OFF, and TUB... Promise weekly deliveries. Then offer a 10% kickback to the governor / parliament member who contracted them. 

Because the parliament isn't spending their own money, they would be happy to pay an exhorbitant delivery fee to avoid messing with the recurring deliveries. The payments to the supplier are public, but the kickback would be hidden from public view. So everyone wins.

[03-Jul-24 01:40 PM] katinga#0000
Question: what does the Reserve do in the Upkeep UI for infrastructure buildings?  Does that stockpile for the next upkeep cycle(s)


[03-Jul-24 01:40 PM] archielvahr#0000
Yep


[03-Jul-24 01:41 PM] archielvahr#0000
The "Next consumption" is the next 3 or 5 or 10 days or whatever, then the reserve rolls into it. The reserve can usually hold like 30 days of stuff.


[03-Jul-24 01:42 PM] archielvahr#0000
The actual amount of needs generated is the average fullness of the Next Consumption bar during the week


[03-Jul-24 01:42 PM] archielvahr#0000
(or maybe more precisely, the fullness of the next consumption bar at the end of each consumption cycle, summed up for the week)... hard to be exactly sure.


[03-Jul-24 01:42 PM] archielvahr#0000
In practice, people either keep the bar full or empty for a cycle.


[03-Jul-24 01:43 PM] katinga#0000
that's cool though that you can take care of upkeep for a while


[03-Jul-24 01:43 PM] archielvahr#0000
Athough supplying half a bar of something could have value to fine tune.. it's just too hard to fine tune that way


[03-Jul-24 01:45 PM] hernanduer#0000
also the little teeny tiny movement bars make that impossible


[03-Jul-24 01:45 PM] hernanduer#0000
really should have a number entry box as well

[18-Aug-24 02:36 AM] allocater#0000
what technology did you use for this?


[18-Aug-24 09:14 AM] archielvahr#0000
The map is Taiyi's map with a bunch of changes. It's written in React and D3 for the node drawing and visualization stuff. The map itself is a big SVG and you can pick out parts of the SVG by systemID and add components to it that way

{Reactions}
üëç 

[18-Aug-24 09:15 AM] archielvahr#0000
I don't really understand React very well at all, but it's not too hard to mess with


[18-Aug-24 09:17 AM] allocater#0000
I want to get into React at some point. My last web knowledge is AJAX from 2009 üòÑ


[18-Aug-24 09:18 AM] archielvahr#0000
Heh, I still whip out php sometimes when I need to make some web stuff


[18-Aug-24 09:19 AM] archielvahr#0000
The rest of the OOG website is Hugo, a static site generator


[18-Aug-24 09:23 AM] archielvahr#0000
It's my second Hugo page, and I'm not really sure what I think about it. If you get a nice template, it looks really good. Most templates (including this one) have some sort of issues that prevent it from "just working". And it's inevitable that you need to edit the template a fair bit. So basically you need to have full knowledge of HTML and CSS anyway to make a hugo page. Then y ou also need to know markdown and whatever random npm libraries the hugo template uses. Each template usually uses at least 20 of those. So for this page the only one I needed to really mess with was Tailwind, and some hugo version mismatches that needed cleaning


[18-Aug-24 01:24 PM] exeler#0000
Sounds like my experience every time I try to contribute to a project that uses npm. 

It never just works.

{Reactions}
üíØ

[28-Aug-24 03:32 PM] archielvahr#0000
http://kortham.net/temp/firefox_vbAUzs3Bpe.png

{Embed}
http://kortham.net/temp/firefox_vbAUzs3Bpe.png
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/RO2gzNi3_GKOa8Eq1VdxTKpPVw-enhLoK6OLu-dqkQk/http/kortham.net/temp/firefox_vbAUzs3Bpe.png


[28-Aug-24 03:37 PM] archielvahr#0000
Okay so this gigantic sheet. It assumes everything is made at 160% efficiency, with materials sourced from the CX at the average price. I will do a version with home-made materials too. It includes input costs, workforce costs, and building depreciation. It calculates the area to make something based on the size of the building, plus the size of the housing needed to build it.


[28-Aug-24 03:38 PM] archielvahr#0000
So the 500 area col is gonna be on the high end because it's going to assume you have 0 unused space, 0 STO, and you somehow got fractional numbers of SLs built, and no unused pop.


[28-Aug-24 03:39 PM] archielvahr#0000
In practice, I think it's pretty close, esp assuming you probably got a bit over 160% efficiency


[28-Aug-24 03:39 PM] archielvahr#0000
In cases where prices are wonky for precursors, like drones frames or something, it's going to suffer a bit, either too high or too low.


[28-Aug-24 03:40 PM] archielvahr#0000
I think the best solution is to hand enter override prices on things you can figure out. But that's a ton of work.


[28-Aug-24 03:40 PM] archielvahr#0000
Furthermore, these are the old MM prices, so that needs fixing by hand.


[28-Aug-24 03:40 PM] archielvahr#0000
but it's a start.


[28-Aug-24 03:41 PM] akyantor#0000

[28-Aug-24 04:36 PM] archielvahr#0000
FFCs mats cost 276,500 on the CX


[28-Aug-24 04:37 PM] archielvahr#0000
But that's cause WAI on the CX is 118k and you could make your own for 70k (assuming you bought the WAI components on the CX!) So it's recursive savings. But then you gotta work that into the area and time cost too.


[28-Aug-24 04:37 PM] archielvahr#0000
If you want 1 FFC per day, it takes 270.6 area to do that, assuming you build the entire chain yourself.


[28-Aug-24 04:38 PM] archielvahr#0000
(All material inputs but not workforce consumables)


[28-Aug-24 04:39 PM] archielvahr#0000
for the FFC, 129.0 of that area is in the AFP and employee housing for the AFP


[28-Aug-24 04:40 PM] archielvahr#0000
(because it takes 2.5d / eff to build an FFC, we assume you have (1 / (2.5 / 1.7)) AFPs to do that )

[29-Aug-24 12:07 PM] archielvahr#0000
Drones initially look good, because you can do great with 12 DRS on a planet. But if you actually have to make the BSC for them... those are priced at 0, so bam, you need like 1200 area for those 12 DRS. etc. So if you run the math out for the whole chain, it takes a ton of extra area to feed the DRS. It's probably worse than what the sheet is saying there, which is if you make the whole DRS chain, for every 500 area you put into it, you make 105k. per day. I'm a little doubtful on some of that math though. I might want a different approach for it

[29-Aug-24 01:40 PM] archielvahr#0000
One goofy thing I ran into was that I needed to use different prices at different points. So making an SRD uses UTS. But it needs to price that input at 4700 per UTS. But UTS is also a MM, so if you want to sell UTS, it needs to use the 2200/u price.


[29-Aug-24 01:40 PM] shrewdsun_88540#0000
I would argue if it is indeed gate stuff, there is a high likely hood of those things selling higher than mm off the market I‚Äôm the very beginning when all the accumulated great fortunes fight to build gates


[29-Aug-24 01:41 PM] archielvahr#0000
At first, I had UTS at 2200, then it made the SRDs too cheap. But you need to use the MM price of the SRDs at 53k instead of the market 97k, because the demand isn't there for that volume


[29-Aug-24 01:42 PM] marat_sh#0000
can you separate them? UTS_MM and UTS_IN?


[29-Aug-24 01:42 PM] archielvahr#0000
Yeah that's what I ended up doing.. each item has a "production price" = what it would cost to make. A "real price" which is the MM price, and a "main price" = the price to buy it on the CX


[29-Aug-24 01:43 PM] archielvahr#0000
And a checkbox at the sheet to swap which one gets used


[29-Aug-24 01:44 PM] archielvahr#0000
My price to produce 1 AUO is 85.4, the MM is 137, the CX is 250

[29-Aug-24 03:28 PM] archielvahr#0000
This sums in profit from earlier phases, which is important for CBL. CBL bases run at a loss if you only run the CBLs with CX priced inputs. But if you make the inputs yourself you capture the income from the earlier steps. So this should be entirely resilient to price variations on the CX of input materials if you look at that one "whole chain" column


[29-Aug-24 04:15 PM] hernanduer#0000
I think your efficiencies aren't being calculated right


[29-Aug-24 04:15 PM] hernanduer#0000
you're dividing by the efficiency in column AP on the RO-Recipe Values


[29-Aug-24 04:15 PM] hernanduer#0000
but I think it should be multiplied by efficiency (oops)


[29-Aug-24 04:16 PM] hernanduer#0000
for example: in apex time for 3 IDC at 176% shows 40 hours to complete


[29-Aug-24 04:16 PM] hernanduer#0000
unmodified is 72 hours


[29-Aug-24 04:16 PM] hernanduer#0000
72/40 = ~1.8


[29-Aug-24 04:16 PM] hernanduer#0000
so it should be that your area behaves the same, but for IDC your area is 13.37


[29-Aug-24 04:16 PM] hernanduer#0000
20/13.37 = 1.5, not 1.8


[29-Aug-24 04:17 PM] hernanduer#0000
should be 20/11.36


[29-Aug-24 04:17 PM] archielvahr#0000

[29-Aug-24 04:21 PM] archielvahr#0000

At 176.50% efficiency it should be that number *1.71 = 0.0747 IDC per day per unit area

[16-Sep-24 10:03 PM] hernanduer#0000

{Attachments}
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/870777970367811604/1285436052928073789/image.png?ex=6814dedd&is=68138d5d&hm=c105ac52427b1ba0b517561c5ed2d61321022c45021d9b9ed60105e99349ef4e&


[16-Sep-24 10:10 PM] hernanduer#0000
okay, so that's the updated chart


[16-Sep-24 10:11 PM] hernanduer#0000
and here's a new one: total number of materials needed, and then the colors are a scale of how long it'll take to make *just that stage* of the material


[16-Sep-24 10:11 PM] hernanduer#0000
so for example, the AL time is just the time spent in SMEs


[16-Sep-24 10:12 PM] hernanduer#0000
specifically this recipe SME:6xALO-1xC-1xFLX-1xO=>4xAL


[16-Sep-24 10:12 PM] hernanduer#0000
so now we can see exactly where time needs to be spent making material parts


[16-Sep-24 10:12 PM] hernanduer#0000
MAI is high use because the C recipe in use is INC:4xHCP-2xMAI=>4xC


[16-Sep-24 10:16 PM] hernanduer#0000

Gateway Question Roundup
Hi! We have a few answers:  Can one gateway send ships to more than one receiving gateway? Or does the gateway builder / controlling government set the destination?   Links are 1:1.  If they are paired, can the destination gateway be changed? How often?   Gateway destinations can be changed anytime (only via motions for now).  Can one gateway re...

[18-Sep-24 10:14 AM] hernanduer#0000
I posted this in the behind the scenes channel:
"so with some of those answers, I'm extremely concerned to run these gates in faction space while they're owned by a government 
if someone funds a gate-pair and then some other force builds a single gate at a different destination, there can be constant conflict trying to get the gate changed
and I don't like having roughly 300mil in "constant conflict" for no reason
governments are basically unaccountable, if they owe a debt there's absolutely zero guarantee it'll be paid. I think I'd wait for gateways to be ownable by corporations to do anything"

[22-Sep-24 05:53 PM] sidepipe#0000
minor success üôÇ

{Attachments}
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/870777970367811604/1287547447685545985/image.png?ex=6814a441&is=681352c1&hm=42903b3cfe91b8c3b8d0d3db66b52fb3df92d6325cc1de6d6543396e09d191c0&


[22-Sep-24 05:54 PM] sidepipe#0000
so what I tried to do is:


[22-Sep-24 05:55 PM] sidepipe#0000
given the static settings for ELP and MCA above, minimize the $ amount of stuff overproduced on the right (based on the PP30D prices for each)


[22-Sep-24 05:56 PM] sidepipe#0000
and limiting the maximum order length to 14 days for any given item, to make it a bit easier to bootstrap (previous solutions were coming up with like 1.5 month order times to shave off an extra .3 HD overproduced per day üòÑ )


[22-Sep-24 06:05 PM] sidepipe#0000
oh yeah, and that all those intermediate products were produced at a surplus, but just keeping that surplus as small as possible with the price constraint


[22-Sep-24 07:47 PM] sidepipe#0000
so. I have 2 solutions that should work (I haven't tested the second one in prunplanner yet) - but important question: is 100 BWS a week way more than the market can handle?


[22-Sep-24 07:49 PM] sidepipe#0000
Right now I'm looking at making either 50 per week, which would take up half of two permits on OS-099c and d, or 100 per week to take up almost the whole lot. I guess the former leaves room for other electonics stuff if there's anything people are particularly interested in


[22-Sep-24 07:50 PM] sidepipe#0000
this is solution #2 btw. I think it should fit into two permits but I don't even wanna put it into prunplanner if 100 BWS per week seems like overkill üòÑ

[28-Sep-24 03:42 PM] melon164#0000
You physically can't fit more than 48 hours worth of inputs and consumables, and most of the recipes are weight-increasing, so you can't even hide lots of inventory in the queue because you can't get it out again.  My Bober base has 9 AML and it's probably a third of my shipping üò≠


[28-Sep-24 03:44 PM] exeler#0000

[28-Sep-24 03:46 PM] melon164#0000

[28-Sep-24 03:47 PM] exeler#0000

[28-Sep-24 03:48 PM] melon164#0000
No, have to move stuff


[28-Sep-24 04:02 PM] melon164#0000
Eg: the 320 BER plus 10 BTS is enough to start the next round, but the BER recipe expands so you can't store more than one round.  So I have two days to get the ship back with more BER, plus enough empty space to shuffle things around, or the second cycle will jam it up.

Michi talks about gateways and tries to answer some questions from the community about them.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/WAiDYBKsBxqq7foni4z5b22q4lzQqXdUPEK9VeTGuC4/https/cdn.prosperousuniverse.com/website/og_image/release_presence.jpg

{Reactions}
üëç 

[30-Sep-24 09:02 AM] archielvahr#0000
Apparently, what they previously said about gateway links must be 1:1 and symmetric didn't mean what we thought, because they have just written: 

``` So, why 'links' in plural then? While a gateway can only have one outgoing link, several other gateways might link to this gateway. We need a way to show which other gateways want to link to this gateway, so the operators can make an informed decision about the link.```

and 

``` Once the link is established, ships can travel between the gateways in both directions ```


[30-Sep-24 09:03 AM] archielvahr#0000
Made note of this in ADI: https://discord.com/channels/1183243037430796339/1283881894966202469/1290312851273285715


[30-Sep-24 09:03 AM] archielvahr#0000

[30-Sep-24 09:15 AM] hernanduer#0000
I cleared it out there, but if the links aren't reciprocal then the link is incomplete

> That other gateway has to link back in order for the link to be complete.
Seems like they are saying that gateway operator needs to approve incoming links from other gateway in order for link to become operational.

I know that the ANT coalition is planning exactly that, and it seems like some corps will essentially merge into the same coalition, and therefore share system.

I think we can definitely have some sway if we have any preferences, as available capital is of course a concern. Honestly I don't know how many people will be able to spend even 1-10M in the support of this, and so we expect the vast majority of funding to come from the relatively few of us wealthier players (i.e. ~100M+ net worth).

Gateways will be a multi-year, multi-stage project to connect the various regions, the primary usage being connecting the 4 main CX regions.

[31-Oct-24 02:19 PM] archielvahr#0000
A big PrunPlanner change went into effect today:

`Workforce Cost Integration: After extensive discussion on the PCT Discord, workforce costs are now factored into daily revenue and ROI projections for recipes.`

I think a lot of people were relying very heavily on the recipe ROI numbers and not paying too close attention to the total base ROI, so over time. this might shift around some prices.

They both alternate between GRN & HER every cycle.


[02-Nov-24 09:18 PM] tuffyless#0000
H2O kinda gets tight when adding in the production of DW for long periods of time on FP bases.
So I find the need to manually dethrottle on some things requiring less H2O for abit so it'll catch up.
It's a manual-balancing act.


[02-Nov-24 09:25 PM] tuffyless#0000
Supply for H2O comes from Etherwind, ISA, and SE-648b.  
648b swaps between BER & H2O but it spends most of the time on H2O.
Rarely have to buy from Zip except in extreme situations.

{Reactions}
‚úåÔ∏è

[02-Dec-24 12:31 PM] superbadsounds#0000
So I'm looking at plans for Styx c and b.. and what I can contribute there, and I feel like I could help fill the TSH, ADE, and ATA we still need.

My thoughts are to get these bases up and rolling, let them recoup the 15m (11m build, 4m consumables) investment over the first 45 days or so, and then divert 5 TSH, 5 ADE, and 5 ATA to the gateways each day for 3-4 months.

AGC Contributions and fulfillment goals would be:
650 TSH (with Construction COGC: 130 days/with Manufacturing COGC: 163 days)
560 ADE (with Construction COGC: 112/with Manufacturing COGC: 140)
690 ATA (with Construction COGC: 138/with Manufacturing COGC: 173)

The total timeline for my contributions would be roughly 180-210 days (June 2025) and should net me about 10% ownership of the project shares. 

Styx c (TSH, ADE, and ATA)
https://prunplanner.org/shared/70f5dab3-fb98-49c2-9d58-4c4753225d89

Aratora (Support for Styx c with: CF, HE)
https://prunplanner.org/shared/a74711d3-262c-4642-b6ef-67d551733f68

My main concerns are with pops and the COGC change down the line.

Styx c will need 320 TEC and 240 ENG, while Aratora will need 140 TEC and 100 ENG. Only Styx c has the TEC, and neither planet has any ENG currently. What does the timeline usually look like for developing t4 pops?

When do you expect we might switch Styx c to Manufacturing? I think I can still make these plans work with a mismatched COGC, but I'm also open to moving construction operations to Styx d if it makes more sense.

bonus question..

When do we expect Gateways to be released? A quick search around the discords didn't bring out anything obvious. If it's far enough away, I could contribute more TSH and AFABS. If I have until late Septemeber 2025, I could supply all the remaining TSH and switch my AFAB production to make 350 ABH and 350 ASE when the time is right. My total contribution would be at about 16.5% by that point with 1000 TSH, 350 ABH, 560 ADE, 350 ASE, 690 ATA.

[16-Dec-24 11:21 AM] sidepipe#0000
personally, I don't take loans at this point because I have enough cash to do what I want, but with >1M daily profit there's not really a reason not to take loans. you can just take larger amounts / pay them back faster

[16-Dec-24 02:11 PM] sidepipe#0000
they are, but there are usually cheaper alternatives for those buildings, and the demand is tiny compared to how many are produced. for example, the level 5 UNI on malahat only uses 75 IDC every 20 days


[16-Dec-24 02:12 PM] cptboby#0000
huh


[16-Dec-24 02:12 PM] cptboby#0000
and what is MM?


[16-Dec-24 02:13 PM] sidepipe#0000
market maker - it's those infinite orders you see in certain order books


[16-Dec-24 02:13 PM] sidepipe#0000
basically the game will buy or sell an infinite amount of an item to you at a certain price


[16-Dec-24 02:14 PM] sidepipe#0000
so the basic goods like DW, RAT have them so the universe never runs out, and some high-level goods like IDC have buy orders so there's always demand


[16-Dec-24 02:17 PM] cptboby#0000
wierd way of injecting money into the system


[16-Dec-24 02:24 PM] allocater#0000
it's the main cause of inflation


[16-Dec-24 02:26 PM] cptboby#0000
not enough money sink

[18-Dec-24 01:29 PM] archielvahr#0000
So this is what it sounds like it works like. 
Someone builds a "packager" building. It takes 100 DW, 100 RAT, 10 OVE, 10 COF, 5 PWO, plus some "packaging material" like PE or something. Then it makes 1 "packaged consumable. And you ship the consumable somewhere and it unpacks and you feed your workforce.

{Reactions}

[23-Mar-25 05:44 PM] archielvahr#0000
https://discord.com/channels/350171287785701388/350171288267915277/1353423057557000296


[23-Mar-25 05:44 PM] archielvahr#0000
The numbers are here:


[23-Mar-25 05:44 PM] archielvahr#0000
https://com.prosperousuniverse.com/t/major-market-maker-pricing-changes/6933

{Embed}
https://com.prosperousuniverse.com/t/major-market-maker-pricing-changes/6933
Major Market Maker Pricing Changes
As talked about on discord, I want to make a forum thread for people who might not see that. And gather more input.  The extremely quick tl;dr is: Adjusting the price of marketmakers to align with two factors. Difficulty of the recipe, and tier of workforce that is needed to make it. Something which is easy is rewarded lowly, something which is ...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/6W5SHunX37UWsgj98Xp5RkBInYFFXRgZ0O-7kvpwQI4/https/com.prosperousuniverse.com/uploads/default/optimized/2X/d/d7345c855a40f3540976d2e165a31589f591c34b_2_1024x472.png


[23-Mar-25 05:44 PM] archielvahr#0000

[23-Mar-25 07:25 PM] superbadsounds#0000
I support this.. though I was just considering decommissioning my last APF chains for the time being.


[23-Mar-25 07:39 PM] evov#0000
A very cursory look at the proposed prices leads me to the following broad/macro outlook.

1. High tier manufacturing planets will be in high demand.
2. Ship prices will increase.
3. Electronics will still be required, but emphasis will shift from SCI to some of the lower pops.
4. Construction ( by way of Welding plants ) will have increased demand.


[23-Mar-25 07:58 PM] evov#0000
I think one of the side effects of having more complicated things be more profitable (drones / lis etc ) will be that it makes it harder for solo players to take advantage of money printers and benefits groups/ collectives/ collaboration/ trade.


[23-Mar-25 09:25 PM] archielvahr#0000
Hm I hadn't thought about that. If someone really wants to make LIS or drones in high quantities, a coop model might be good. I guess I make most of the stuff on the list already (except drones), so none of it seems too inaccessible. I think the ship price increase will be pretty small, since LIS usually seems to be traded fairly close to the new MM price. Our "internal" price is 450k, but it usually trades around 600-700k.

Degradation could be a percentage of the stock per week with different rates per MAT.
This would also disincentivize hording, unless packaged.
Newer players would not suffer as much due to the small stocks and quick turnarounds. One could also introduce a X month grace period for new players.

[14-Apr-25 05:49 PM] evov#0000
A quick look at the numbers - roughly....
IDC/EDC aren't worth making unless consume prices get a LOT cheaper.
I think AIR is likely the most profitable. Which will put upward pressure on all the things that go into it ( a lot of low/mid tier items in that chain will be "worth" more... consequences are that other low/mid tier items made by the same buildings will also get more expensive imo )
A number of drone products are also looking quite good.
Drones draw from a good amount of electronics, but also chemistry and manufacturing planets.

There's a few unchanged MM's ( capacitor banks, LOG ) that are more attractive, if only for the reason that the juiciest fruit got nerfed, so the baseline expectation for Area Profitability is lower now.

[21-Apr-25 12:18 PM] akyantor#0000
I've build something a while ago that calcuates the cost of each material that I produce that factors in pop consumables + taxes, but want to expand it to include building degredation.. seems complex though.


[21-Apr-25 12:20 PM] akyantor#0000
It looks like you might assume you roughly repair half the material cost of the building every 60 days. So could split half that cost across 60 days worth of run time to get something very rough.

Is this different from what prun planner does?

Company HQ:
Does location just give a flat boost to all production on planet?

[28-Apr-25 08:45 PM] .urpalhal#0000
* CORP HQ gives a 10% production boost
* Company HQ location determines permit boost type and where to take mats for HQ upgrades
* permit count affects the boost you get from your company HQ location


[28-Apr-25 08:45 PM] .urpalhal#0000
Relocating your Company Hq is free but you can only do it once a month
